session_summary: Jolene and Deborah caught up at 9:48 am on February 4, 2023. Jolene shared her recent success in creating a water purifier for a rural community, showcasing her engineering skills. Deborah praised her and encouraged Jolene to continue making a positive impact through engineering. Deborah also mentioned her passion for teaching yoga and bonding with Anna, sharing a modified pose. They discussed favorite books, nature spots, and reflecting on loved ones. Deborah shared how a bouquet from a friend gave her hope, while Jolene noted the power of small gestures. Both emphasized finding strength in memories and supporting each other through tough times. They exchanged warm goodbyes, with Deborah encouraging Jolene to stay in touch and Jolene expressing gratitude for the support.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Hey Deborah! Good to hear from you. How've you been? I've been on an emotional rollercoaster lately, but I'm coping.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Hey Jolene! Good to hear from you. All good here - how about you? Anything new happening lately?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: I had a major milestone last week and it went really well - I'm so relieved and proud. It was a huge accomplishment for me as an engineer.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: That's awesome. You must have worked really hard for that. I'm so proud of you. Care to share more about it?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Thanks so much! I had to plan and research a lot to design and build a sustainable water purifier for a rural community in need. It was tough, but I loved the experience.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Your engineering skills really made a difference for people in a rural area. That's amazing! How did it feel when you saw it working?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: It was such a surreal moment. Seeing it working and providing clean water to the community was incredibly satisfying. It reminded me of how engineering can make a difference in people's lives. It made me feel like I had a purpose and had done something good.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: So, what are your career aspirations now?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: I want to keep working in engineering and continue to make a positive impact on communities in need by creating sustainable solutions. My goal is to contribute towards making the world a better place with my work.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: I'm sure great things will keep coming your way. Keep up the good work and follow your passions!

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Your support means a lot. I'm determined to keep going and make a difference. Your encouragement really motivates me to pursue my passions.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of two women in a dance studio doing a dance pose
conversation_turns.text: When things get tough, just take a deep breath and remember why you're doing this. This is where I spend a lot of my time, teaching yoga. It's a great way to find balance and reconnect with ourselves. I bonded with Anna during yesterday's l yoga class.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Wow, that's awesome! What new poses did you try?

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a woman doing a yoga pose on a chair
conversation_turns.text: We were trying out different dance poses, like Warrior II, which builds strength and boosts focus.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Is it difficult to do?

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Yes, but this brought us closer to Anna! We supported each other, that means a lot.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Can you explain how to do it?

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Sure! To do this modified pose, sit on the edge of a chair with your feet planted. Twist your torso to one side and use your hand on your knee for support. You'll feel a stretch in your back and shoulders as you hold it for a few breaths, then switch sides. It's great for relaxing tense muscles.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a book shelf with a lot of books on it
conversation_turns.text: Sounds really hard! Here's my bookshelf!

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: That's quite a collection! Have you had a favorite book lately? I'd love to hear your thoughts.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Thanks Deborah! I'm really into this book called "Sapiens" - it's a fascinating look at human history and how technology has affected us. It's giving me a lot to think about!

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Great, this is interesting! Have you come across any recent ones that really struck you?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Two weeks ago I read "Avalanche" by Neal Stephenson in one sitting!

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: That sounds cool, Jolene. Stories can be so powerful - they can teach us, motivate us, and bring us together.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: I also read a recent story about someone who became successful despite facing numerous challenges. It really showed me that anything is possible if you believe and work hard.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a bouquet of flowers in a vase on a table
conversation_turns.text: That's a really powerful message. It reminds me of someone special and their grace and strength when they faced hardships. Check out this creation!

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Wow, Deb! That's beautiful! Can you tell me the backstory of that bouquet?

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: My friend gave me this bouquet when I was struggling, and it gives me hope and courage. I'm filled with warmth and appreciation when I look at it.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: That's really sweet. Such a small thing can make a real difference.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: It's amazing how something as simple as flowers can make a real difference. Nature sure is beautiful.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Where are some of your favorite nature spots?

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Oh, there's so many great places! My favorite is a park with a forest trail - it's so calming getting lost in nature. Then there's this beach nearby that I love - the sound of the waves and the sand under my feet make me feel all peaceful and happy. Do you have any favorite spots, Jolene?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a person walking on the beach with a surfboard
conversation_turns.text: Here's a picture I took on vacation last summer in Bogota. It was so beautiful and calming watching the sunset over the water. It definitely made me appreciate nature's calming power.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a small island with a lone boat in the water
conversation_turns.text: That sounds great, Jolene. Nature's calming for sure. Guess it helps us forget the daily craziness and find inner peace. No wonder you're a fan! I like to come to this spot by the water near my mom's old house. It's where I reflect on her life and find some peace. Being surrounded by nature helps a lot.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: That's so touching! Do you have any little traditions that you do when you come to reflect on your mom?

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a woman wearing a white shirt and a gold chain necklace
conversation_turns.text: Do you remember this amulet from her? Whenever I come here, I bring it with me. It's how I feel her love and stay close to her. Holding it brings me comfort.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: It's amazing how something so small can have such a big impact, huh?

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Yeah, even small things like this can make a big difference. It's a reminder of all the love and strength we have inside, connecting us to people we've lost and comforting us.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: It can keep them close in our hearts every day.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Anna also has a pendant that she wears in memory of her mother! This also brought us closer.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: It's nice to have those reminders as a source of strength when we need it.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Life's tough but hang in there. Look to your sources of strength and you'll do great. Stay in touch, take care of yourself, and know I'm always here to cheer you on!

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Thanks, Deb! Your encouragement means a lot to me. I'll definitely stay in touch. Bye, take care and keep shining!

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Stay safe!  Bye!

Deborah: Deborah further bonds with her neighbor Anna during yoga class while trying out the Warrior II yoga pose and over their shared memories of their late mothers.
Jolene: Jolene finishes working on a sustainable water purifier for providing clean water to rural communities and derives a lot of satisfaction from the impact created by the project.
Jolene had a major milestone last week in engineering where she designed and built a sustainable water purifier for a rural community.
Jolene wants to continue working in engineering to make a positive impact on communities in need by creating sustainable solutions.
Jolene is into reading, particularly enjoying the books "Sapiens" and "Avalanche" by Neal Stephenson.
Jolene appreciates nature's calming power and enjoys watching sunsets over the water.
Deborah: Deborah spends a lot of time teaching yoga as a way to find balance and reconnect with herself.
Deborah has a bouquet that was given to her by a friend during a tough time, which gives her hope and courage.
Deborah has a little amulet from her mom that she brings with her when reflecting on her mom. It brings her comfort and connects her to her mom's love.
Deborah enjoys nature and has favorite spots in a park with a forest trail and a beach nearby.
Deborah values supporting others, as seen when she bonded with Anna during a yoga class and shared stories with Jolene.
